p: For the DPPH radical scavenging assay, the IC 50 was determined for each essential oil using Graph Pad Prism 8.2.1 software. This factor represents the essential oil concentration which decreased the DPPH concentration by 50%. The flower essential oil showed a greater radical scavenging activity (IC 50: 15.53 ± 0.14 µg/mL) than those from the leaves harvested in July of the first (IC 50: 21.96 ± 0.25 µg/mL) and second (IC 50: 71.19 ± 1.33 µg/mL) periods. Trolox and ascorbic acid showed IC 50 values of 12.36 ± 0.02 and 11.80 ± 0.01 µg/mL, respectively ( Table 6).
